chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason P. Wiese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling or combination of the two.  When not fully engaged complete 5 hours community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Maintain stable residence, enrollment and completion of cognitive intervention programming, completion of psychosexual evaluation and following through with all recommendations.  DNA sample. 

Complete any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  

Comply with sex offender rules deemed appropriate by agent, including no unsupervised contact with minor females without agent approval, no use of social media or internet or computers without agents approval.  

Comply with sex offender registry program.

timeConds.notes: SERVE 9 months jail (4 days credit towards 9 mos jail) and I&S 3 months for RULES VIOLATIONS.  NO EMP.  Huber release for work or treatment if meets jail criteria.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:29pm
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Deft appears in person with Atty Chris Lummis
Date and time set for sentencing

States notes all parties have received PSI and there are no corrections to PSI
State recites joint agreement into record
Atty Lummis makes statement
Court makes findings
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 (Child enticement-sexual contact): w/hold sentencing. 10 years probation. CONDITIONS: 1 year MCJ: serve 9 months jail and I/S 3 months for rule violations. NO EMP. Deft has 45 days to report to jail or may be sooner at agents discrection. Huber release for work or treatment if meets jail criteria. Maintain stable residence, enrollment and completion of cognative intervention programming, completion of psychosexual evaluation and follow through with all recommendations. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Comply with sex offender rules deemed appropriate by agent, including no suprevised contact with minor females without agent approval, no use of social media or internet or computers w/o agents approval. Comply with sex offender registry program. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 5 hours community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 4 days credit granted towards 9 months jail. 

PSI to be kept by both parties in sealed confidential manner.

Sentencing hearing on September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
